New Records: Yoshinobu Yamamoto had a commanding performance across 6.1 innings, allowing just one hit (home run via Juan Soto) and recording four strikeouts in his World Series debut.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani appeared to suffer a left shoulder injury at the end of the seventh inning when he tried to steal second base but landed awkwardly while sliding.
Teoscar Hernandez and Freddie Freeman hit back-to-back homers in the bottom of the third to give the Dodgers a 4-1 lead.
Juan Soto tied the game 1-1 with a solo home run off Yamamoto in the third.
Tommy Edman hit a solo home run in the second inning off of Rodón, giving the Dodgers a 1-0 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman is focused on the future, specifically Game 2 and Yankees starter Carlos Rodón after his historic walk-off grand slam in Game 1.
The Dodgers honored former player Fernando Valenzuela with a suite display.
Alex Rodriguez watches Giancarlo Stanton take early batting practice.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts said Shohei Ohtani is showing good strength and good range of motion following a shoulder injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Los Angeles Dodgers are headed to New York up 2-0 after winning Game 2 of the World Series.
Rapper Ice Cube performed on the Dodger Stadium field ahead of the first pitch for Game 2.
The Dodgers have already put up a display honoring Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam in Game 1 of the World Series.
Others: The World Series features a 2-3-2 format where the higher seed hosts Games 1 and 2, along with Games 6 and 7 if necessary.
